description: This notification occurs when ap begin to update.
This notification occurs when ap has updated successfully or failed.
The value of this object identifies the status of the upgrade or the last result of the upgrade.
The value ranges from 0 to 10.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysWlanApUpgradeProgressStatus

description: This notification occurs when ap uboot not match version.

event.Summary: WLAN AP U-Boot version mismatch detected

description: This notification occurs when ap upgrade-assistant-package not match version.

event.Summary: Upgrade assistant package version mismatch detected

description: This object indicates the notification sent when the system clock changes.
When the system clock changes, this trap is triggered. For example,
the system clock is changed through command lines.
This object indicates the local time of the device.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysLocalClock

description: This object indicates the restart notification.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadNotification HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadImage i 9999 HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadCfgFile i 9999 HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadReason s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadScheduleTime s EXAMPLEE HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadAction i 1 HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadPafFile i 9999 HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadLicenseFile i 9999 HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadPatchFile i 9999 HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadAndroidFile i 9999

description: The value of this object identifies the image file used after the restart.
The value is limited by hwSysImageTable.
The value ranges from 1 to 2147483647.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadImage

description: The value of this object identifies the configuration file used after the restart.
The value is limited by hwSysCFGFileTable.
The value ranges from 0 to 2147483647.
The default value is 0, which means the configuration file remains unchanged.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadCfgFile

description: This object indicates the cause of the restart.
The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters.
After the system restarts, the character string is deleted.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadReason

description: This object indicates the time of the restart.
The only valid value of this object is an 8-byte string which indicates the local time of the switch.
The maximum scheduled time is 30 days from the current system clock time. If the value set is earlier
than the value of hwSysLocalClock or beyond the maximum scheduled time limit, a bad value error occurred.
The value of all-zero octet strings indicates system restart at once if the reload action is reloadOnSchedule(1).
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadScheduleTime

description: The value of this object identifies restart types.
1: reloadUnavailable
2: reloadOnSchedule, indicating periodical restart
3: reloadAtOnce, indicating immediate restart without considering hwSysReloadScheduleTime
4: reloadCancel, indicating that all the planned restart activities are cancelled. If hwSysReloadSchedule
is invalid or the rows that hwSysReloadScheduleEntry and hwSysReloadSchedule point to are not activated,
all the restart activities are ignored and an inconsistent value is returned.
When the restart of the system is complete or no restart activities exist, the value of this object is reloadUnavailable(1).
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadAction

description: The value of this object identifies the PAF file used after the restart.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadPafFile

description: The value of this object identifies the license file used after the restart.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadLicenseFile

description: The value of this object identifies the patch file used after the restart.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadPatchFile

description: The value of this object identifies the android file used after the restart.
The value is limited by hwSysAndroidFileTable.
The value ranges from 0 to 2147483647.
The default value is 0, which means the android file remains unchanged.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadAndroidFile

description: When the hard disk on master board cannot be read and written because of a certain error,
the hard disk on master board is unregistered and the notification is sent.

event.Summary: Error detected in system master hard disk

description: When the hard disk on slave board cannot be read and written because of a certain error,
the hard disk on slave board is unregistered and the notification is sent.

event.Summary: Error detected in system slave hard disk

description: Notification about a patch operation failure. This trap is reported when patch installation or patch status configuration fails.
The trap contents include hwPatchErrorSlot, hwPatchErrorPatchIndex, hwPatchErrorCode, and hwPatchErrorPatchFileName.

event.Summary: Patch installation or patch status configuration failed

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchErrorTrap HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchErrorSlot u 9999 HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchErrorPatchIndex u 9999 HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchErrorCode i 1 HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchErrorPatchFileName s EXAMPLE

description: This object indicates the number of the slot related to a patch error.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchErrorSlot

description: This object indicates the index of the patch when the patch has an error.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchErrorPatchIndex

description: This object indicates the flag of the patch error.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchErrorCode

description: This object indicates the index of the patch file when the patch has an error.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchErrorPatchFileName

description: The patch is not run within 24 hours after it is activated.

event.Summary: Patch activated but not run within 24 hours

description: status of the patch.
patchRunning(1): indicates that current status of the patch is Run.
patchActive(2): indicates that current status of the patch is Active.
patchDeactive(3): indicates that current status of the patch is Deactive.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchOperateState

description: The patch operation is restored.
status of the patch.
patchRunning(1): indicates that current status of the patch is Run.
patchActive(2): indicates that current status of the patch is Active.
patchDeactive(3): indicates that current status of the patch is Deactive.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchOperateState

description: Notification about a trap status change. This trap is reported when patch installation or patch status configuration succeeds.

event.Summary: Patch installation or patch status configuration succeeded

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchUpdateTrap HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchVersion s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchType i 1 HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchOperateState i 1

description: This object indicates the version of the patch file.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchVersion

description: The value of this object identifies the patch type.
hotCommon(1): indicates the common hot patch.
hotTemporary(2): indicates the temporary hot patch.
coolCommon(3): indicates the common cool patch.
coolTemporary(4): indicates the temporary cool patch.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchType

description: status of the patch.
patchRunning(1): indicates that current status of the patch is Run.
patchActive(2): indicates that current status of the patch is Active.
patchDeactive(3): indicates that current status of the patch is Deactive.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchOperateState

description: When the cfcard on master board can't be read and written because
of some error, the Cfcard on master board will be unregistered and
the notification is sent.

event.Summary: Error detected in CF card on master board

description: When the cfcard on slave board can't be read and written because
of some error, the Cfcard on slave board will be unregistered and
the notification is sent.

event.Summary: Error detected in CF card on slave board

description: This object indicates that the hwSysSlaveSwitchChassisNum
chassis is successfully switched.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysSlaveSwitchSuccessNotification HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysSlaveSwitchChassisNum s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysSlaveSwitchSrc s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysSlaveSwitchDst s EXAMPLE

description: The value of the object identifies the chassis number.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysSlaveSwitchChassisNum

description: The source slot for slave switchover.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysSlaveSwitchSrc

description: The destination slot for slave switchover.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysSlaveSwitchDst

description: This object indicates that the hwSysSlaveSwitchChassisNum
chassis fails to be switched.
The value of the object identifies the chassis number.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysSlaveSwitchChassisNum

description: When the ISSU upgrade over, it will send success or failed message.
System issu upgrade state.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwIssuState

description: System issu upgrade condition check.
The default check result is normal.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwIssuConditionCheck

description: The patch package install fail notification.

event.Summary: Patch package installaton failed due to $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchInstallFail HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchUsedFileName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchVersion s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchFailReason i 1

description: This object indicates the name of the patch file.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchUsedFileName

description: This object indicates the version of the patch file.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchVersion

description: This object is an index that specifies patch fail reason.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchFailReason

description: The patch package install fail clear notification.

event.Summary: Patch package installation failure alarm cleared

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchInstallFailClear HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchUsedFileName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchVersion s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchFailReason i 1

description: This object indicates the name of the patch file.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchUsedFileName

description: This object indicates the version of the patch file.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchVersion

description: This object is an index that specifies patch fail reason.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwPatchFailReason

description: The patch package upgrade success notification
The value of this object identifies the version of the image file.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysImageVersion

description: This object notifies that some error occurs when the configuration file is specified as the next startup configuration file.

event.Summary: System configuration file ($v1) error detected due to $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysCfgFileErrorNotification HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysCFGFileName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysCFGFileReason s EXAMPLE

description: This object indicates the name of the configuration file.
Currently, Huawei products support two formats of configuration files, namely, .CFG and .ZIP.
A file name containing path and suffix is a string of 5 to 64 characters.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysCFGFileName

description: This object indicates the error cause of the configuration file.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysCFGFileReason

description: The image file upgrade fail notification. The first hwSysImageName indicates the current image file
and the second hwSysImageName indicates the next startup image file.

event.Summary: Image file ($v1) upgradation failed due to $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysImageErrorNotification HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysImageName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysImageName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysImageReason s EXAMPLE

description: This object indicates the name of the image file.
A file name containing path and suffix is a string of 4 to 64 characters.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysImageName

description: This object indicates the name of the image file.
A file name containing path and suffix is a string of 4 to 64 characters.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysImageName

description: The value of this object identifies the error cause of the image file.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysImageReason

description: This object indicates the notification sent when the system PAF file changes.The hwSysPafFileName indicates system PAF file
and the hwSysReloadEntity indicates the board type(1 means main board,2 means slave main board).
This object indicates the index of the restarting entity.
The value is referred to from entPhysicalTable.
1. When get/get-next, 1 means active main board, 2 means slave main board
65535 means other board.
2. When set, 2 means slave main board, other values mean active main board.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadEntity

description: This object indicates the name of the PAF file.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysPafFileName

description: This object indicates the notification sent when the system license file changes.The hwSysLicenseFileName indicates the system license file
and the hwSysReloadEntity indicates the board type(1 means main board,2 means slave main board).
This object indicates the index of the restarting entity.
The value is referred to from entPhysicalTable.
1. When get/get-next, 1 means active main board, 2 means slave main board
65535 means other board.
2. When set, 2 means slave main board, other values mean active main board.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysReloadEntity

description: This object indicates the name of the license file.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSysLicenseFileName

description: The board(s) excluded during software upgrading

event.Summary: System board excluded during software upgrade

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-SYS-MAN-MIB::hwSystemBoardExclude ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalIndex i 9999 ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName s EXAMPLE

description: The index for this entry.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalIndex

description: The textual name of the physical entity. The value of this
object should be the name of the component as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name (e.g., `console') or a simple component number (e.g.
port or module number, such as `1'), depending on the
physical component naming syntax of the device.
If there is no local name, or if this object is otherwise
not applicable, then this object contains a zero-length
string.
Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical
entities will be the same in the event that the console
interface does not distinguish between them, e.g., slot-1
and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName

description: The board(s) excluded retrieved during software upgrading
The index for this entry.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalIndex

description: The textual name of the physical entity. The value of this
object should be the name of the component as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name (e.g., `console') or a simple component number (e.g.
port or module number, such as `1'), depending on the
physical component naming syntax of the device.
If there is no local name, or if this object is otherwise
not applicable, then this object contains a zero-length
string.
Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical
entities will be the same in the event that the console
interface does not distinguish between them, e.g., slot-1
and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName
